channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Incremental Constrained Clustering by Minimal Weighted Modification
item.description: Clustering is a well-known task in Data Mining that aims at grouping data instances according to their similarity.

item.title: TCOVIS: Temporally Consistent Online Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: The core of our method consists of a global instance assignment strategy and a spatio-temporal enhancement module, which improve the temporal consistency of the features from two aspects.

item.title: Dictionary Attack on IMU-based Gait Authentication
item.description: We present a novel adversarial model for authentication systems that use gait patterns recorded by the inertial measurement unit (IMU) built into smartphones.

item.title: Emotion-Aware Prosodic Phrasing for Expressive Text-to-Speech
item.description: Prosodic phrasing is crucial to the naturalness and intelligibility of end-to-end Text-to-Speech (TTS).

item.title: Activation Compression of Graph Neural Networks using Block-wise Quantization with Improved Variance Minimization
item.description: Further, we present a correction to the assumptions on the distribution of intermediate activation maps in EXACT (assumed to be uniform) and show improved variance estimations of the quantization and dequantization steps.

item.title: Convolution and Attention Mixer for Synthetic Aperture Radar Image Change Detection
item.description: In this letter, we explore Transformer-like architecture for SAR change detection to incorporate global attention.

item.title: Smooth ECE: Principled Reliability Diagrams via Kernel Smoothing
item.description: We show that a simple modification fixes both constructions: first smooth the observations using an RBF kernel, then compute the Expected Calibration Error (ECE) of this smoothed function.

item.title: Active Stereo Without Pattern Projector
item.description: This paper proposes a novel framework integrating the principles of active stereo in standard passive camera systems without a physical pattern projector.

item.title: TMac: Temporal Multi-Modal Graph Learning for Acoustic Event Classification
item.description: We observe that these audiovisual data naturally have temporal attributes, such as the time information for each frame in the video.

item.title: MEFLUT: Unsupervised 1D Lookup Tables for Multi-exposure Image Fusion
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new approach for high-quality multi-exposure image fusion (MEF).

item.title: FGFusion: Fine-Grained Lidar-Camera Fusion for 3D Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we propose Fine-Grained Lidar-Camera Fusion (FGFusion) that make full use of multi-scale features of image and point cloud and fuse them in a fine-grained way.

item.title: A Vision-Centric Approach for Static Map Element Annotation
item.description: The recent development of online static map element (a. k. a.

item.title: Unveiling the Hidden Realm: Self-supervised Skeleton-based Action Recognition in Occluded Environments
item.description: To integrate action recognition methods into autonomous robotic systems, it is crucial to consider adverse situations involving target occlusions.

item.title: Beyond Image Borders: Learning Feature Extrapolation for Unbounded Image Composition
item.description: In this paper, we circumvent this issue by presenting a joint framework for both unbounded recommendation of camera view and image composition (i. e., UNIC).

item.title: Privacy-Preserving In-Context Learning with Differentially Private Few-Shot Generation
item.description: Our results demonstrate that our algorithm can achieve competitive performance with strong privacy levels.

item.title: AutoPET Challenge 2023: Sliding Window-based Optimization of U-Net
item.description: Tumor segmentation in medical imaging is crucial and relies on precise delineation.

item.title: Uplift vs. predictive modeling: a theoretical analysis
item.description: Despite the growing popularity of machine-learning techniques in decision-making, the added value of causal-oriented strategies with respect to pure machine-learning approaches has rarely been quantified in the literature.

item.title: ContextRef: Evaluating Referenceless Metrics For Image Description Generation
item.description: None of the methods is successful with ContextRef, but we show that careful fine-tuning yields substantial improvements.

item.title: Focal Inferential Infusion Coupled with Tractable Density Discrimination for Implicit Hate Speech Detection
item.description: Although pre-trained large language models (PLMs) have achieved state-of-the-art on many NLP tasks, they lack understanding of subtle expressions of implicit hate speech.

item.title: SALSA-CLRS: A Sparse and Scalable Benchmark for Algorithmic Reasoning
item.description: We introduce an extension to the CLRS algorithmic learning benchmark, prioritizing scalability and the utilization of sparse representations.

item.title: Bad Actor, Good Advisor: Exploring the Role of Large Language Models in Fake News Detection
item.description: To instantiate this proposal, we design an adaptive rationale guidance network for fake news detection (ARG), in which SLMs selectively acquire insights on news analysis from the LLMs' rationales.

item.title: Multimodal Transformers for Wireless Communications: A Case Study in Beam Prediction
item.description: Wireless communications at high-frequency bands with large antenna arrays face challenges in beam management, which can potentially be improved by multimodality sensing information from cameras, LiDAR, radar, and GPS.

item.title: t-EER: Parameter-Free Tandem Evaluation of Countermeasures and Biometric Comparators
item.description: The proposed approach is a strong candidate metric for the tandem evaluation of PAD systems and biometric comparators.

item.title: FluentEditor: Text-based Speech Editing by Considering Acoustic and Prosody Consistency
item.description: Text-based speech editing (TSE) techniques are designed to enable users to edit the output audio by modifying the input text transcript instead of the audio itself.

item.title: Generating Hierarchical Structures for Improved Time Series Classification Using Stochastic Splitting Functions
item.description: This study introduces a novel hierarchical divisive clustering approach with stochastic splitting functions (SSFs) to enhance classification performance in multi-class datasets through hierarchical classification (HC).

item.title: How Robust is Google's Bard to Adversarial Image Attacks?
item.description: By attacking white-box surrogate vision encoders or MLLMs, the generated adversarial examples can mislead Bard to output wrong image descriptions with a 22% success rate based solely on the transferability.

item.title: SemEval-2022 Task 7: Identifying Plausible Clarifications of Implicit and Underspecified Phrases in Instructional Texts
item.description: We describe SemEval-2022 Task 7, a shared task on rating the plausibility of clarifications in instructional texts.

item.title: InstructERC: Reforming Emotion Recognition in Conversation with a Retrieval Multi-task LLMs Framework
item.description: The development of emotion recognition in dialogue (ERC) has been consistently hindered by the complexity of pipeline designs, leading to ERC models that often overfit to specific datasets and dialogue patterns.

item.title: A class-weighted supervised contrastive learning long-tailed bearing fault diagnosis approach using quadratic neural network
item.description: In this paper, we propose a supervised contrastive learning approach with a class-aware loss function to enhance the feature extraction capability of neural networks for fault diagnosis.

item.title: LongLoRA: Efficient Fine-tuning of Long-Context Large Language Models
item.description: LongLoRA adopts LLaMA2 7B from 4k context to 100k, or LLaMA2 70B to 32k on a single 8x A100 machine.

item.title: SAM-OCTA: A Fine-Tuning Strategy for Applying Foundation Model to OCTA Image Segmentation Tasks
item.description: In the analysis of optical coherence tomography angiography (OCTA) images, the operation of segmenting specific targets is necessary.

item.title: Code Soliloquies for Accurate Calculations in Large Language Models
item.description: Our approach notably enhances the quality of synthetic conversation datasets, especially for subjects that are calculation-intensive.

item.title: AceGPT, Localizing Large Language Models in Arabic
item.description: This paper explores the imperative need and methodology for developing a localized Large Language Model (LLM) tailored for Arabic, a language with unique cultural characteristics that are not adequately addressed by current mainstream models like ChatGPT.

item.title: The Reversal Curse: LLMs trained on "A is B" fail to learn "B is A"
item.description: This shows a failure of logical deduction that we hypothesize is caused by the Reversal Curse.

item.title: SR-PredictAO: Session-based Recommendation with High-Capability Predictor Add-On
item.description: In this framework, we propose a high-capability predictor module which could alleviate the effect of random user's behavior for prediction.

item.title: Incorporating Singletons and Mention-based Features in Coreference Resolution via Multi-task Learning for Better Generalization
item.description: Previous attempts to incorporate a mention detection step into end-to-end neural coreference resolution for English have been hampered by the lack of singleton mention span data as well as other entity information.

item.title: Face Aging via Diffusion-based Editing
item.description: We propose FADING, a novel approach to address Face Aging via DIffusion-based editiNG.

item.title: Kosmos-2.5: A Multimodal Literate Model
item.description: We present Kosmos-2. 5, a multimodal literate model for machine reading of text-intensive images.

item.title: RHALE: Robust and Heterogeneity-aware Accumulated Local Effects
item.description: RHALE quantifies the heterogeneity by considering the standard deviation of the local effects and automatically determines an optimal variable-size bin-splitting.

item.title: Gold-YOLO: Efficient Object Detector via Gather-and-Distribute Mechanism
item.description: In the past years, YOLO-series models have emerged as the leading approaches in the area of real-time object detection.

item.title: Are Large Language Models Really Robust to Word-Level Perturbations?
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel rational evaluation approach that leverages pre-trained reward models as diagnostic tools to evaluate the robustness of LLMs, which we refer to as the Reward Model for Reasonable Robustness Evaluation (TREvaL).

item.title: Language-driven Object Fusion into Neural Radiance Fields with Pose-Conditioned Dataset Updates
item.description: Specifically, to insert a new foreground object represented by a set of multi-view images into a background radiance field, we use a text-to-image diffusion model to learn and generate combined images that fuse the object of interest into the given background across views.

item.title: Rethinking Sensors Modeling: Hierarchical Information Enhanced Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Then, we generate representative and common spatio-temporal patterns as global nodes to reflect a global dependency between sensors and provide auxiliary information for spatio-temporal dependency learning.

item.title: COSE: A Consistency-Sensitivity Metric for Saliency on Image Classification
item.description: We present a set of metrics that utilize vision priors to effectively assess the performance of saliency methods on image classification tasks.

item.title: Locate and Verify: A Two-Stream Network for Improved Deepfake Detection
item.description: Deepfake has taken the world by storm, triggering a trust crisis.

item.title: CATS: Conditional Adversarial Trajectory Synthesis for Privacy-Preserving Trajectory Data Publication Using Deep Learning Approaches
item.description: The prevalence of ubiquitous location-aware devices and mobile Internet enables us to collect massive individual-level trajectory dataset from users.

item.title: CPLLM: Clinical Prediction with Large Language Models
item.description: We present Clinical Prediction with Large Language Models (CPLLM), a method that involves fine-tuning a pre-trained Large Language Model (LLM) for clinical disease prediction.

item.title: Towards Robust Few-shot Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Few-shot point cloud semantic segmentation aims to train a model to quickly adapt to new unseen classes with only a handful of support set samples.

item.title: Generalized Few-Shot Point Cloud Segmentation Via Geometric Words
item.description: Existing fully-supervised point cloud segmentation methods suffer in the dynamic testing environment with emerging new classes.

item.title: GL-Fusion: Global-Local Fusion Network for Multi-view Echocardiogram Video Segmentation
item.description: Additionally, a Multi-view Local-based Fusion Module (MLFM) is designed to extract correlations of cardiac structures from different views.
